data.title: Venus on the Half Shell by Kilgore Trout, First Edition
data.meta_description: Venus on the Half-Shell by Trout, Kilgore and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Soft cover. Condition: Good. 1st Edition. Pulpy mass market paperback with wear to lurid cover, former owner's name on title page, and discoloration from age. That it was written by a fictional character is a puzzle.

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Very Good. First Edition. First edition in book format. This is a paperback. Previously serialized in The Magazine of Fantasy and Science Fiction. Wraps very good with light to moderate wear including creasing and edge wear. Spine is uncreased. Binding sound. Small numerical notation penned to inside front cover, and a previous owner's namestamp. Pages lightly age-toned. Text unmarked.

Paperback. Condition: Very Good(+). First printing (stated). Black duodecimo, smaller than octavo, 204 pages; 18 cm. Science Fiction. Kilgore Trout is a pseudonym of Philip José Farmer. Venus picture to front pastedown. Extremely mild rubbing to spine head and foot, light crease to front hinge, extremely gentle rubbing to corners, extremely faint soiling to rear cover, very small and light crease to front-rear edge, else Very Good(+). No creasing to spine. Tight.

Soft Cover. Condition: Very Good +. Dust Jacket Condition: No Jacket - As Published. First Edition. Both volumes (Volume 47, #6 and Volume 48, #1) are in very good + condition. Some toning to the back panel of the first volume, but tight and square. This is the first appearance of this novel, and a bit hard to find in this above average condition. Previous owner's mail label to back panel. Magazine.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First (and only?) hardcover edition, first printing. Very Good+ rubbed and visibly lightly soiled and stained hardback issued without dust jacket. A clean but visibly lightly dirty copy. Embossed lettering on front boards and spine is clean and unmarked.

Hardcover. SF novel by Farmer, using the name of (and also written in the style of) a character (a hack sf writer) in several Kurt Vonnegut novels. First published as a 1975 Dell paperback original. Fine copy as issued without dustjacket (as new). First hardcover edition (& 1st printing).

Magazine. Condition: Very Good +. First Edition/First Printing. Two square solid tight carefully read copies. The above novel appears here, in two parts, for the first time. Both copies have the usual pagedge browning, lightish rubbing wear, light cover soil, mailing labels. First appearance of the novel. Trout was a pigment of the imagination of Kurt Vonnegut, the novel was written by Philip Jose Farmer using the pseudonym. This edition also includes a short biographical sketch of Trout. This issue also features a new Zenna Henderson story about the People. Book.

Softcover. Condition: Very Good. First edition. Mass market paperback original. Very good with wear at the edge and some corner creases. The "author" Kilgore Trout is a fictional character who appears in several works by Kurt Vonnegut, loosely inspired by the real science-fiction and horror author Theodore Sturgeon. This fictitious title by the fictitious author was first mentioned by Vonnegut in his 1965 novel *God Bless You, Mr. Rosewater*. Almost a decade later Vonnegut gave Farmer permission to use the pseudonym and title, although reportedly afterward he was displeased by the confusion this publication created among readers. *Dell* 6149.

Softcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: No Dust Jacket. First Edition; First Printing. First edition. Paperback original. Very good+ in pictorial printed wrappers. (Mild trace of damping at small segment of bottom edge . Not at all messy. Couple small soil spots on inside front cover. Hints of shelf-wear & creasing) ) Humorous parody of Kurt Vonnegut's early Sci-Fi style perpetrated by Philip Jose Farmer.
